value.name: Message Identification
value.description: Point to point reference, as assigned by the instructing party and sent to the next party in the chain, to unambiguously identify the message. Usage: The instructing party has to make sure that MessageIdentification is unique per instructed party for a pre-agreed period.

value.name: Creation Date Time
value.description: Date and time at which the message was created.

value.name: Code
value.description: Specifies the authorisation, in a coded form.

value.name: Proprietary
value.description: Specifies the authorisation, in a free text form.

value.name: Authorisation
value.description: User identification or any user key to be used to check whether the initiating party is allowed to initiate transactions from the account specified in the message. Usage: The content is not of a technical nature, but reflects the organisational structure at the initiating side. The authorisation element can typically be used in relay scenarios, payment initiations, payment returns or payment reversals that are initiated on behalf of a party different from the initiating party.

value.name: Batch Booking
value.description: Identifies whether a single entry per individual transaction or a batch entry for the sum of the amounts of all transactions within the group of a message is requested. Usage: Batch booking is used to request and not order a possible batch booking.

value.name: Number Of Transactions
value.description: Number of individual transactions contained in the message.

value.name: Control Sum
value.description: Total of all individual amounts included in the message, irrespective of currencies.

value.name: Group Return
value.description: Indicates whether the return applies to the whole group of transactions or to individual transactions within the original group(s).

value.name: Total Returned Interbank Settlement Amount
value.description: Total amount of money moved between the instructing agent and the instructed agent in the return message.

value.name: Interbank Settlement Date
value.description: Date on which the amount of money ceases to be available to the agent that owes it and when the amount of money becomes available to the agent to which it is due.

value.name: Settlement Method
value.description: Method used to settle the (batch of) payment instructions.

value.name: IBAN
value.description: International Bank Account Number (IBAN) - identifier used internationally by financial institutions to uniquely identify the account of a customer. Further specifications of the format and content of the IBAN can be found in the standard ISO 13616 "Banking and related financial services - International Bank Account Number (IBAN)" version 1997-10-01, or later revisions.

value.name: Identification
value.description: Identification assigned by an institution.

value.name: Code
value.description: Name of the identification scheme, in a coded form as published in an external list.

value.name: Proprietary
value.description: Name of the identification scheme, in a free text form.

value.name: Scheme Name
value.description: Name of the identification scheme.

value.name: Issuer
value.description: Entity that assigns the identification.

value.name: Other
value.description: Unique identification of an account, as assigned by the account servicer, using an identification scheme.

value.name: Identification
value.description: Unique and unambiguous identification for the account between the account owner and the account servicer.

value.name: Code
value.description: Account type, in a coded form.

value.name: Proprietary
value.description: Nature or use of the account in a proprietary form.

value.name: Type
value.description: Specifies the nature, or use of the account.

value.name: Currency
value.description: Identification of the currency in which the account is held.  Usage: Currency should only be used in case one and the same account number covers several currencies and the initiating party needs to identify which currency needs to be used for settlement on the account.

value.name: Name
value.description: Name of the account, as assigned by the account servicing institution, in agreement with the account owner in order to provide an additional means of identification of the account. Usage: The account name is different from the account owner name. The account name is used in certain user communities to provide a means of identifying the account, in addition to the account owner's identity and the account number.

value.name: Settlement Account
value.description: A specific purpose account used to post debit and credit entries as a result of the transaction.

value.name: Code
value.description: Infrastructure through which the payment instruction is processed, as published in an external clearing system identification code list.

value.name: Proprietary
value.description: Clearing system identification in a proprietary form.

value.name: Clearing System
value.description: Specification of a pre-agreed offering between clearing agents or the channel through which the payment instruction is processed.

value.name: BIC
value.description: Code allocated to a financial institution by the ISO 9362 Registration Authority as described in ISO 9362 "Banking - Banking telecommunication messages - Business identifier code (BIC)".

value.description: Identification of a clearing system, in a coded form as published in an external list.

value.name: Proprietary

value.name: Clearing System Identification
value.description: Specification of a pre-agreed offering between clearing agents or the channel through which the payment instruction is processed.

value.name: Member Identification
value.description: Identification of a member of a clearing system.

value.description: Information used to identify a member within a clearing system.

value.name: Name
value.description: Name by which an agent is known and which is usually used to identify that agent.

value.name: Original Interbank Settlement Amount
value.description: Amount of money, as provided in the original transaction, to be moved between the instructing agent and the instructed agent.

value.name: Returned Interbank Settlement Amount
value.description: Amount of money moved between the instructing agent and the instructed agent in the returned transaction.

value.name: Interbank Settlement Date
value.description: Date on which the amount of money ceases to be available to the agent that owes it and when the amount of money becomes available to the agent to which it is due. Usage: the InterbankSettlementDate is the interbank settlement date of the return message, and not of the original instruction.

value.name: Returned Instructed Amount
value.description: Amount of money to be moved between the debtor and the creditor, before deduction of charges, in the returned transaction.

value.name: Exchange Rate
value.description: Factor used to convert an amount from one currency into another. This reflects the price at which one currency was bought with another currency.

value.name: Compensation Amount
value.description: Amount of money asked or paid as compensation for the processing of the instruction.

value.name: Charge Bearer
value.description: Specifies which party/parties will bear the charges associated with the processing of the payment transaction. Usage: The ChargeBearer applies to the return message, not to the original instruction.

value.name: Amount
value.description: Transaction charges to be paid by the charge bearer.

value.name: IBAN
value.description: International Bank Account Number (IBAN) - identifier used internationally by financial institutions to uniquely identify the account of a customer. Further specifications of the format and content of the IBAN can be found in the standard ISO 13616 "Banking and related financial services - International Bank Account Number (IBAN)" version 1997-10-01, or later revisions.

value.name: Identification
value.description: Unique and unambiguous identification for the account between the account owner and the account servicer.

value.name: Code
value.description: Account type, in a coded form.

value.name: Proprietary
value.description: Nature or use of the account in a proprietary form.

value.name: Type
value.description: Specifies the nature, or use of the account.

value.name: Currency
value.description: Identification of the currency in which the account is held.  Usage: Currency should only be used in case one and the same account number covers several currencies and the initiating party needs to identify which currency needs to be used for settlement on the account.

value.name: Name
value.description: Name of the account, as assigned by the account servicing institution, in agreement with the account owner in order to provide an additional means of identification of the account. Usage: The account name is different from the account owner name. The account name is used in certain user communities to provide a means of identifying the account, in addition to the account owner's identity and the account number.

value.name: Creditor Account
value.description: Unambiguous identification of the account of the creditor to which a credit entry will be posted as a result of the payment transaction.

value.name: Address Type

value.name: Street Name
value.description: Name of a street or thoroughfare.

value.name: Building Number
value.description: Number that identifies the position of a building on a street.

value.name: Post Code
value.description: Identifier consisting of a group of letters and/or numbers that is added to a postal address to assist the sorting of mail.

value.name: Town Name
value.description: Name of a built-up area, with defined boundaries, and a local government.

value.name: Country Sub Division
value.description: Identifies a subdivision of a country such as state, region, county.

value.name: Country
value.description: Nation with its own government.

value.name: Address Line
value.description: Information that locates and identifies a specific address, as defined by postal services, presented in free format text.

value.name: Postal Address
value.description: Information that locates and identifies a specific address, as defined by postal services.
